info-registry-entry.namespace-title: Namespace of identifiers for RefSeq reference sequence record

namespace-authority.organisation-address: National Library of Medicine, National Institutes of Health, Building 38A, 8600 Rockville Pike, Bethesda, MD 20894, USA

identifier-syntax.description: RefSeq Accession Numbers are identifiers assigned to all publicly available nucleotide sequences provided by the NCBI RefSeq project. Nucleotide sequence accession numbers can be 2 letter + underscore ("_") + 6-8 digits. The first two letters impart information about the type of sequence data contained within the record. RefSeq records that are based on Whole Genome Shotgun sequence project data may have accession numbers that are 2 letter + underscore + 4 letters + 8-10 digits. The first two digits represent the version number of the assembly and the subsequent 6-8 represent the sequence contig number.
